intro: Hieracium wierzbickii, commonly known as the Wierzbicki hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Central and Eastern Europe, where it thrives in meadows and grassy areas. The plant is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers and hairy leaves, which help it adapt to various environmental conditions. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 20 to 50 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
